pageContext.claim: “I did criminal justice reform, which President Obama could not get approved -- which the media never talks about. If President Obama got criminal justice reform done, it would be front-page stories all over the place. I got it done.”
pageContext.analysis: Major news organizations extensively covered the First Step Act, which Trump signed in 2018 and which was described as historic criminal justice reform. In these remarks, Trump oversells his accomplishment and undersells President Barack Obama's role. One of the biggest pieces of the First Step Act -- a provision that reduced sentences for crack cocaine offenses -- was an extension of Obama’s efforts in 2010.
